abstract.text: Defines an audio queue buffer.

inlineContent.text: Each audio queue has an associated set of audio queue buffers.  To allocate a buffer, call the
function. To dispose of a buffer, call the
If using a VBR compressed audio data format, you may want to instead use the
function. This function allocates a buffer with additional space for packet descriptions. The
fields may only be used with buffers allocated with

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Asks an audio queue object to allocate an audio queue buffer.
Defines an audio queue buffer.
The audio data owned the audio queue buffer. The buffer address cannot be changed.
The number of bytes of valid audio data in the audio queue bufferâ€™s
field, initially set to
. Your callback must set this value for a playback audio queue; for recording, the recording audio queue sets the value.
The size of the audio queue buffer, in bytes. This size is set when a buffer is allocated and cannot be changed.
The maximum number of packet descriptions that can be stored in the
field.
The number of valid packet descriptions in the buffer. You set this value when providing buffers for playback. The audio queue sets this value when returning buffers from a recording queue.
An array of
structures for the buffer.
The custom data structure you specify, for use by your callback function, when creating a recording or playback audio queue.
A pointer to an audio queue buffer.
Asks an audio queue to dispose of an audio queue buffer.
Specifies the current level metering information for one channel of an audio queue.
Specifies an audio queue parameter and associated value.
A
value that uniquely identifies an audio queue parameter.
A
value for an audio queue parameter.
